flow.descriptionCdata:
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.08e9a347-2fa3-4992-9c04-44cf2ffd54d6.prompt=Please Select Process to Execute (FailOverTo DR / FallBack To Prod)\: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.0e65d5f1-119b-46ee-a922-7c4bc7fe4222.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.1794f351-65d4-497a-8486-eb9c1e28f419.prompt=Please Enter Server IP on which Service/Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.1ca3289e-aac5-43dd-8608-b7274a7ccd22.description=
This flow sends, stores or displays a notification message according to your notification type selection. You can use this flow to select how to be notified about the outcome of other flows. 

Inputs\:
    notifyData -  The content of the notification message.
    notifyMethod - The notification type. This value is not case sensitive.
Valid values\: Write to File, Email, Display or None
    subject - A summary of the notification content. 
    destination - The destination of the notification. You must specify a value for this input if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’ or ‘Write to File’.
Valid values\: An email address or a file name
    notificationServer - The email server used to send the notification email message. If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    from - The email address of the sender of the notification email message.  If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    serverPort - The notification service’s server port. This field’s value is used when the "notifyMethod" is ‘Email’, but it is optional.
Default value\: 25
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/HTML format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.
Default value\: true

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    To schedule a flow that uses this flow, you need to supply all the required fields for the used notification method. For example, if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘File’, the "destination" input must also be specified.

Examples\:
    This is a valid input example for storing a notification message to a file\:
      notifyData\: notificationContent
      notifyMethod\: Write to File
      subject\: notificationSubject
      destination\: C\:\Program File\notification.txt
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.21ebc2fe-0b80-4e87-abdb-2c3c9aa82fe5.prompt=Please Select Appropriate Tomcat Service To Look For On Mentioned Servers \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.33a9c60a-ec32-4a00-b436-4fe69e9ddc55.prompt=Please Enter Application Name \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.351d31b8-f16f-4ec8-97f1-6d017f3d3dbd.prompt=Please Enter Server IP on which Service/Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.4068f60e-1711-4345-8396-b27ff947b400.prompt=Please Enter Name of Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.4bbdd741-f00e-4a75-92ed-c834674060ca.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.65e0478d-8c36-4d62-94d5-e050b207c381.description=
This flow sends, stores or displays a notification message according to your notification type selection. You can use this flow to select how to be notified about the outcome of other flows. 

Inputs\:
    notifyData -  The content of the notification message.
    notifyMethod - The notification type. This value is not case sensitive.
Valid values\: Write to File, Email, Display or None
    subject - A summary of the notification content. 
    destination - The destination of the notification. You must specify a value for this input if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’ or ‘Write to File’.
Valid values\: An email address or a file name
    notificationServer - The email server used to send the notification email message. If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    from - The email address of the sender of the notification email message.  If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    serverPort - The notification service’s server port. This field’s value is used when the "notifyMethod" is ‘Email’, but it is optional.
Default value\: 25
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/HTML format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.
Default value\: true

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    To schedule a flow that uses this flow, you need to supply all the required fields for the used notification method. For example, if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘File’, the "destination" input must also be specified.

Examples\:
    This is a valid input example for storing a notification message to a file\:
      notifyData\: notificationContent
      notifyMethod\: Write to File
      subject\: notificationSubject
      destination\: C\:\Program File\notification.txt
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.6f6997bb-f9b7-4bee-a281-bad617e427db.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.7f94370c-b9ee-4b32-a8da-9fbd3eef9914.prompt=Please Enter Name of Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.813d41f0-c7bd-48de-8abd-de866452b022.description=
This flow sends, stores or displays a notification message according to your notification type selection. You can use this flow to select how to be notified about the outcome of other flows. 

Inputs\:
    notifyData -  The content of the notification message.
    notifyMethod - The notification type. This value is not case sensitive.
Valid values\: Write to File, Email, Display or None
    subject - A summary of the notification content. 
    destination - The destination of the notification. You must specify a value for this input if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’ or ‘Write to File’.
Valid values\: An email address or a file name
    notificationServer - The email server used to send the notification email message. If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    from - The email address of the sender of the notification email message.  If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    serverPort - The notification service’s server port. This field’s value is used when the "notifyMethod" is ‘Email’, but it is optional.
Default value\: 25
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/HTML format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.
Default value\: true

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    To schedule a flow that uses this flow, you need to supply all the required fields for the used notification method. For example, if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘File’, the "destination" input must also be specified.

Examples\:
    This is a valid input example for storing a notification message to a file\:
      notifyData\: notificationContent
      notifyMethod\: Write to File
      subject\: notificationSubject
      destination\: C\:\Program File\notification.txt
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.9266fcc4-daa6-4345-be72-e0a5e20c9e43.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.b210f4b7-8ae7-45ea-a580-0be3206d6d6f.description=
Tests a list of URLS to make sure they are responding.

Inputs\:
    List - The list of URLS that will be tested.
    seperator - A separator that is placed between each url that is in the list (must not be in any of the URLs themselves...).
    username - A username to use when connecting to the URLs.
    password - A password to use when connecting to the URLs.
    notifyMethod - How you would like to be notified of the test's outcome.
    timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. 
Default value\: true.
    followRedirects - Specifies whether or not the get command should automatically follow redirects.
Default value\: false.
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
    proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
    characterSet - The character encoding that should be used for the HTTP Get request and response. 
Default value\: UTF-8.
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used. The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and keystore is empty, keystorePassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used. The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file.  If trustAllRoots is false and trustKeystore is empty, trustPassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    kerberosConfFile - Location of the kerberos conf file, used for ntlm authentication.
    headerNamesList - A list containing the names of headers that should be used for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - A list containing the values of headers that should be used for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - A list containing the names of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - A list containing the values of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - A delimiter that separates the elements in the names and values lists.
Default value\: , (comma).

Responses\:
    success - All URLs passed the test, and the email was successfully sent.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Note\:
If you need to specify query parameters when making the request, consider using the “queryNamesList” and “queryValuesList” inputs. The operation also accepts including query parameters in the url (Example\: http\://hostname\:80/page.asp?parameterName1\=parameterValue1¶meterName2\=parameterValue2). If you specify the same query parameter both through the "queryNamesList" and through the url input, then the value from the "queryValuesList" list will be used and not the one included in the url.
6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.b7744e70-238b-4cd7-bada-7ee07c9688fe.description=
This flow sends, stores or displays a notification message according to your notification type selection. You can use this flow to select how to be notified about the outcome of other flows. 

Inputs\:
    notifyData -  The content of the notification message.
    notifyMethod - The notification type. This value is not case sensitive.
Valid values\: Write to File, Email, Display or None
    subject - A summary of the notification content. 
    destination - The destination of the notification. You must specify a value for this input if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’ or ‘Write to File’.
Valid values\: An email address or a file name
    notificationServer - The email server used to send the notification email message. If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    from - The email address of the sender of the notification email message.  If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    serverPort - The notification service’s server port. This field’s value is used when the "notifyMethod" is ‘Email’, but it is optional.
Default value\: 25
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/HTML format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.
Default value\: true

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    To schedule a flow that uses this flow, you need to supply all the required fields for the used notification method. For example, if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘File’, the "destination" input must also be specified.

Examples\:
    This is a valid input example for storing a notification message to a file\:
      notifyData\: notificationContent
      notifyMethod\: Write to File
      subject\: notificationSubject
      destination\: C\:\Program File\notification.txt

6ba3b692-2b32-47a9-a58e-da9e4516e6db.f7adcd6b-675a-439b-a0d5-982b2ec95a40.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
